newsitem.title: USA: U.S. adj retail sales up 0.8 pct in March - Redbook.
newsitem.headline: U.S. adj retail sales up 0.8 pct in March - Redbook.

text.p: U.S. seasonally adjusted retail sales rose 0.8 percent through the fourth week of fiscal March versus February, according to the Lynch, Jones & Ryan Inc Redbook Retail Sales Index.
The index rose 8.3 percent compared to the same month a year ago, the report said. Adjusted retail sales rose 7.9 percent in the week ended March 29 compared with the same week a year ago, it said.
Sales performance in the most recent survey week was somewhat disappointing, said Howard Eilenberg, retail analyst at Lynch, Jones & Ryan.
"We're a little concerned the month will not come in up to expectations," Eilenberg said in an interview with Reuters Financial Television.
In particular, apparel, appliances and home furnishings have slowed from their previous pace, he said.
Expectations are not very high for April, as sales tend to drop off after Easter, Eilenberg said.
"April is a give-back month," he said.
